message: Hey Daphne, glad you could make it. I was skimming your background and, not gonna lie, 80-plus locations is no joke. How did you end up owning something that big?

Glad to be here. I grew into it by consistently fixing hard problems—underperforming markets, leadership gaps, messy operations. Each turnaround led to broader scope, and eventually I was trusted with full regional ownership.
Makes sense. When you're juggling that many stores and leaders, what do you actually spend most of your time on day to day?
Prioritization and people. I focus on the few levers that move revenue and margin, then make sure my leaders are clear, accountable, and developed enough to execute without micromanagement.
I like that answer. You've clearly done a lot of growth work—what's a change you pushed that really stuck and scaled?

Leadership development programs. We built repeatable frameworks for coaching, promotions, and performance management. That's what allowed us to double revenue quarter over quarter without burning teams out.
